titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Education, Creativity, and Free Expression Program (ECX), JustFilms, Office Files of Orlando Bagwell
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Education, Creativity, and Free Expression Program (ECX), JustFilms, Office Files of Orlando Bagwell FA1728

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-10-01 04:55:43 UTC.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Education, Creativity, and Free Expression Program (ECX), JustFilms, Office Files of Orlando Bagwell

physdesc.extent: 14 document containers: 13 letter boxes and 1 oversize box.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at the RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files, and officers' papers were transferred to and accessioned by the RAC beginning in 2011.
This material was transferred to the RAC in 2019 and 2021 in three different sets of records and was ingested by the RAC as Accessions 2019:183, Accession 2021:006, and Accession 2021:078.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection contains the office files Orlando Bagwell created during the time he worked at the Ford Foundation in various capacities related to the Foundation's programming for culture and media. The files span from the time Bagwell joined the Foundation as a Program Officer in the Knowledge, Creativity, and Freedom Program (KCF), Media, Arts, and Culture unit (MAC), to him being Director of MAC, through the program's reorganization into the Education, Creativity, and Free Expression Program (ECX), Freedom of Expression unit, to his directorship of the JustFilms initiative in ECX for documentary grant programming.

The collection consists of one series of subject files that document Bagwell's grant portfolio and program leadership and strategy responsibilities throughout his various positions at Ford. Key highlights of Bagwell's work that the files highlight include his overseeing grant programming for public media and media rights and access, his leadership of the Foundation's five-year Global Perspectives in a Digital Age: Transforming Public Service Media initiative, and his management of grants for social justice related documentaries. Grantees discussed within the files received support for producing films on race and inequality and other social issues, advancing the representation of Latino Americans in film and TV, and strengthening and innovating public media, including media owned by Native American communities.

Common types of documents found throughout the collection include correspondence, memos, drafts, reports, proposals, concept papers, grant recommendations, notes, film treatments, summaries, articles, abstracts, biographies, promo reels and trailers, audio CDs, digital images, digitized recordigns and meeting materials, promotional materials, and publications. There is also a video tape, comic book script, and a photograph album showing Bagwell's visit to Lagos, Nigeria.

did.unittitle: Subject files

physdesc.extent: 14 document containers: 13 letter boxes and 1 oversize box.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series contains Orlando Bagwell's subject files from his various positions in the Ford Foundation's programming for arts and culture including: Knowledge, Creativity, and Freedom Program (KCF), Media, Arts, and Culture unit (MAC) Program Officer; MAC Director; Education, Creativity, and Free Expression Program (ECX), Freedom of Expression unit Director; and ECX, JustFilms Director.

Many of Bagwell's subject files pertaining to his tenure in MAC regard the Foundation's support to organizations and individuals producing social justice documentaries and strengthening and innovating public media. Some of these grantees include California Newsreel, WGBH, and the National Hispanic Foundation for the Arts (NHFA). There is a significant amount of materials documenting MAC's support of the California Newsreel film series Hidden Epidemic and RACE: The Power of an Illusion. Other files provide evidence of the Foundation's self-directed projects regarding public service media and freedom of expression such as the Global Perspectives in a Digital Age: Transforming Public Service Media initiative and the Ford Foundation Freedom of Expression Working Group. Some MAC records were inherited from past MAC Program Officers like John Santos because the projects those records concerned were passed on to Bagwell.

The series' contents show how Bagwell's responsibilities for the Foundation's documentary filmmaking grant portfolio continued through the creation of the JustFilms unit which he directed. Bagwell's attendance at and contributions to various Foundation programs strategy convenings are evidenced in briefing books, agendas, digitized recordings, and other meeting materials. Other common material formats found throughout the series include correspondence, memos, drafts, proposals, grant recommendations, notes, film treatments, summaries, biographies, promo reels and trailers, audio CDs, digital images, publications, articles, promotional materials, a video tape, a comic book script, and a photograph album of Bagwell's visit to Lagos, Nigeria.

Race and inequality, Native American culture and public media, media and digital technology, and Latino American film and TV representation are prominent themes within the grants documented in the series.

When originally processed, this series only contained a limited number of files from Bagwell's time in MAC. Additional subject files from Bagwell's activities for MAC intermixed with records from his other Ford Foundation positions were processed into the series after they were transferred from the Foundation at a later date.
